column5: it wasn't big, hit a 10 in. hard bait, 4 trebles & flew out of the water when hooked, beautiful pattern & color. OCTOBER 19TH, I POSTED PICS--the fish in the holding tank, tiger musky, is the fish in this pic.
Beauty fish!
Is it a tiger for sure? It's a real clean and healthy fish.
Looks like 1 to me. I have boated 1 in my life so I must be an expert. If you ever want to start an argument ask a bunch of Musky hunters "Is this a Tiger Musky?"
I think it's just a regular muskie as the tail lobes seem pretty pointed (it's the only real clear ID feature), but regardless that's a nice fish!Â ðŸ˜Ž
looks like a regular ski to me as well nice catch either way
I'm thinking a barred muskie, either way beauty fish!!!
on october 19th i posted pics from ST.CLAIR with my son, the fish in the holding tank is this fish in this photo, TIGER.
Nice fish, I originally thought it looked more like a barred regular musky, but either way. Think tigers have the pattern on the face.
Looks like a Tiger to me, but the tail fins aren't round... Biologists will not id them just by the markings, but will count the pores on the under side of the jaw.

I am not sure what holding tank pictures you are referring to; but are there any features in particular that would indicate that it is a tiger?Â  The tail and fins look to be very pointed which is associated with pure strain musky.
I am not a musky guy, so don't know the difference, but it is a niceÂ  musky.

Remember posting this one years back that I thought was a tiger muskie.Â  Had similar markings to the fish in this post AND it had the very rounded tiger / pike tail. Was newer to muskie fishing so didn't know for sure, but was told by some hereÂ it's just a barred muskie.Â  Thing of it is, there can likelyÂ be some variations considering a 1st generation tiger couldÂ reproduce with a 100% pike or muskie down the line and offset their typical appearances even more... I suppose?
I thought tiger Muskie were sterile
It is.
Shows what I know about 'em! lol.
it's a barred musky, back at it you go...
NICE fish !

I have one that I had mounted in 81'. I have had Musky experts agree and disagree it is a true Tiger. That was a time you killed and stuffed fish. For many years latter I felt guilty I had it stuffed, then I found out they can't breed. I hope that's true. And I agree what a nice clean Musky. LSC, yep they have that light shade maybe because of the clear water. I found the Pics are a lighter shade too when we fished the lake many Moons ago.
sorry...another opinion that says barred musky. Either way, very nice fish with awesome markings
No such thing as a bad musky no matter what the markings are...they're all good
Looks like barred musky to me as well. Don't feel too bad, I have been duped into thinking I had caught a tiger musky before.
Thatâ€™s a Tiger
Definitely a barred 'ski....the very pointed tail is a dead giveaway. Beautiful looking fish! Josh
